results.title: A Day in the death of Donny B
results.creator_credit: Audio Productions, National Institute of Mental Health (U.S.), Louis Mucciolo and Carl Fick
results.brief_description: A sensitive and frightening portrait of Donny B, a young drug addict, who lives and will probably die in Harlem. To the accompaniament of the song in folk idiom: A Day in the Death of Donny B, we follow him through a day in which he steals enough money for his next “fix”. Shows the utter degradation of a young human being, the hopeless slum environment in which he lives and his situation which can lead to nothing but death.

results.title: A day in the country: impressionism and the french landscape
results.brief_description: Kirk Douglas hosts this program which takes as its starting point an exhibition of impressionist and post-impressionist art at the Los Angeles County Museum of Art. The program focuses on the subject matter chosen by these artists, their emphasis on light and colour, and the new methods and technologies they employed. Prominence is given to the works of Monet, Cezanne and Van Gogh, but almost all of the impressionist and post-impressionists are represented and discussed briefly. A valuable introduction to this important art movement.

results.title: A Day in Perth
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Malcolm Otton and Greg Reading
results.brief_description: Perth is a city growing towards the day when it assumes its place as one of the world’s industrial centres. Recent discoveries of iron ore and other minerals in Western Australia have brought new wealth to the State. Perth is a prosperous city, with a warm, sunny climate, and a relaxed, outdoor way of life.

results.title: A Day in Pacific Rim
results.brief_description: A camera with a painterly approach acquaints its audience with Pacific Rim National Park, located on Vancouver Island, British Columbia. Giant treescapes, drooping moss and the stunningly beautiful ocean provide breathtaking material for an eager eye. A film without words.

results.title: A Day in June: Montreal
results.brief_description: June 24th is celebrated in Montreal with parade and fanfare in memory of St. Jean Baptiste, the patron saint of Quebec. Now more of an historical than a religeous pageant, the “grande parade” consists of a series of tableaux on floats representing events from French Canada’s colourful past. Using candid camera techniques, the film captures the reactions and behaviour of people participating in a public festivity dear to their hearts. Contains some spoken French language.

results.title: A Day in June: disengagement in the Golan
results.creator_credit: United Nations Films, Gilbert Lauzun, Edward Magruder Jones and Joe O'Brien
results.brief_description: In June 1974, a new United Nations peace-keeping force took up positions in the war torn Golan Heights. The force was called UNDOF - United Nations Disengagement Observer Force and its mandate, to observe that the ceasefire agreements, signed in Geneva by Israel and Syria, were adhered to.

results.title: A Day for Being Irish
results.creator_credit: Barinder Productions, Joy Barrow and David E. Barrow
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “A World of Festivals”.
Every year since 1606 the town of Ballycastle in County Antrim, Northern Ireland has held the Lammas Fair to which people come to trade, barter and generally have a good time. Originally the fair was set up for the Scottish overlords of the time to trade their horses for black cattle and other goods that they needed. The nearby islanders of Rathlin also participate in the fair by selling seaweed.

results.title: A Day at the races
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Lawrence Weingarten and Sam Wood
results.brief_description: A Marx Brothers movie combining humor and music. The plot, which shifts from a sanitorium to a race track, introduces a horse doctor masquerading as sanitorium director, a jockey who encourages his horse to win by showing it a picture of the man it hates, a vendor of bad racing tips and a vampire dressed in revealing clothing. Also stars Maureen O’Sullivan.

results.title: A Day at the dump
results.brief_description: A case history examining the folly of haphazard waste disposal. For 25 years, a quarter of a million tons of municipal refuse a year went up in smoke at a Washington dump. Depicts the conditions before funds for a comprehensive waste disposal program were made available. (The solution is presented in “Burn, bury or what?”)
